mean_cn: vi.撤退，撤离；  n.撤退，退却
mean_en: to move away from a place or an enemy because you are in danger or because you have been defeated; to move away or back; to change your mind about something because of criticism or because a situation has become too difficult; to escape to a place that is quieter or safer
sentence: The army was forced to retreat after suffering heavy losses.
sentence_trans: 部队因伤亡惨重而被迫撤退。
word_etyma: re回，向后 + treat拉 → 拉回来 → retreat撤退
